reviews.text: This isn't a luxury hotel but was great for the three of us. Close to the pier, the shops - and a great restaurant next door (Ma'kai). Rooms are adequate but not luxurious, beds okay, room and bathroom clean; and our room (not overlooking the sea) was quiet at night. Parking is easy (underneath the hotel) and relatively cheap; free continental breakfast is very basic, but lots of other choices within a few steps of the hotel. Easy to find driving our rental car on the "wrong" side of the road after a 14 hour flight to LAX...!
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable - good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great location. It faces the Pacific (spring for the top floor ocean view room). It is across the street from the pier, backs up to the 3rd Street Promenade, is close to restaurants and bars (with happy hours). Everything in the room was clean and worked. The Internet was excellent (but not wireless in the room). We had a nice, large balcony to take in the ocean and street scene. The breakfast was the usual juice, coffee, toast, bagels, and muffins. Parking was $15 a day, and you may or may not have a parking space, because the restaurant next door uses it as a valet parking garage, although we had no difficulties. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. This is a nice hotel in a fantastic location. We found it to be a bargain.
reviews.title: WE LOVED IT--GET THE VIEW ROOM

reviews.text: Ocean View isn't top luxury and doesn't try to be but it is absolutely good for it's rating and $$. You can't beat it's location - being on the Ocean Blvd at Santa Monica. There are a dozen+ restaurants & you can pop down to the pier or the Santa Monica mall in 5 mins. It was clean, pleasant, pretty quiet if you have a room facing away from the Blvd which we did & even offered a complimentary breakfast of muffins/toast and coffee which more expensive hotels don't even offer.
reviews.title: Great location, Good 2.5 to 3 star accomodation for your $$
Good location
reviews.text: Santa Monica is a good pick if you're doing LA for a few days & you feel like you can drive & hire a car. Get a GPS because it takes all the stress out of driving in a strange city. You can go do things but come back to a great beach location and it was definately nice to get those sea breezes after the humidity elsewhere. Recommend a full day at Universal Studios with front of line passes, Griffiths Observatory, Paul Getty Museum & of course, a walk down Hollywood Blvd.
This was our first hotel in the states for our 4 week trip traveling around the states, after a 13hr flight to get to L.A and we were exhausted by the time we got to the hotel.
reviews.title: Not worth the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 days after a long trip from Chicago, staying in many good hotels on the way. Our previous 2 nights had been spent at the MGM Signature in Las Vegas. So when we arrived at Santa Monica we felt a bit uneasy as the hotel did not look so good on the outside. Once we got into our room, I have to say that I agree with travelgbug of Toronto. The room (although old, compared to other hotels we stayed at on this trip) was clean and perfectly adequate for our needs. It was also very close to the Pier and the staff were very helpful in giving us maps and advising us where to go etc.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: As I said, at the start we had misgivings but these were unfounded. You have to be aware that everything in Santa Monica is expensive compared to the rest of the USA and we have travelled quite a lot there over the years. Mostly we stay at Holiday Inn or Hilton but just so that you can compare, we paid $£199/$219 per night, however at that time, Holiday Inn were charging $349 per night. As my husband said, everyone at the hotel were respectable and there were no tramps there. (You will know what I mean if you go to Santa Monica!)
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All for $276.00 one night, two beds private balcony with ocean view, Santa Monica Beach. Unfortunately, this hotel is the equivalent to an over price Motel 6. Front desk management was not attentive and rude to needs of residence. Called management 3 times to fix TV remote and the third time remote was still not working. Was, greeted with thin walls, residence and street traffic noise. Entrance to small parking garage is an accident waiting to happen for vehicles. Continental breakfast looked like it was, served in small lobby hallway with people coming and going. Breakfast was bagels, juice, cereal, and coffee was it, so did not hang around.
reviews.title: Not the best experience by far.

reviews.text: Ocean View is AAA member discount hotel. AAA DISCOUNTS NOT HONORED.
reviews.title: Please keep looking for another hotel - DO NOT STAY HERE !

reviews.text: Choose this hotel for view, Santa Monica Beach, was not worth the discomfort. DO NOT RECOMMEND, STAYING AT - Ocean View Hotel 1447 Ocean Avenue, 90401 Santa Monica (Los Angeles), CA.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: It has a great location in Santa Monica, near to the pier, 3thrd promenade street, many restaurants. I stayed here for the first time in 1999, when it was a Best Western, and returned because of this. The price is ok for Santa Monica, but it needs a refurbishments, but the room was clean, and large enough, with internet and tv.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stopped in at the Ocean View on our way up the coast. Mike, the man in charge at the desk, set us up with a beatiful view of the ocean, beach and strip all in one. He also researched the local restaurants for us and sent to our room a list of what we were looking for...great food. When I tried to tip Mike later he refused to take it saying that '' IT'S MY JOB AND I'M JUST GLAD TO HELP''. I found this very refreashing and because I could tell he was sincere, I did not push the issue. What can I say more than this. We really enjoyed ourselves and the service...we will be back.
reviews.title: Great Views, Great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked King Ocean View Balcony. My Wife and I checked in and the desk clerk gave us keys to a room that was already occupied by another couple! !!! We found out our room had been given away to someone else. Settled for another room because the Hotel Manager was going to contact us the next morning to compensate us for the problems. We checked out the next morning and never heard a word from the Hotel Manager!!! Business must be great if this hotels does not care about repeat customers.
reviews.title: Service is everything?

reviews.text: My husband, small daughter and I stayed here for three nights in April; we stayed in a standard room with 2 double beds and had a small balcony which overlooked the car park.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic but was nice and clean, with a TV and coffee maker (which was replenished daily). The bathroom was of a reasonable size, the towels were of a good quality and there was a supply of toiletries. Whilst we had a balcony, the view wasn’t particularly exciting and we didn’t bother to use it.
reviews.title: Avoid the

reviews.text: The lowest priced 3 star the weekend I was traveling. Won't blow your socks off with amenities (no iron), but my room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Justin, the manager from NH, was very helpful and courteous. Gave some good dinner recommendations, and chose a nice quiet room. Free internet. $15/night to park. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Great Location, Decent Price, Decent Quality

reviews.text: My husband and 10 month old daughter recently stayed at the Ocean View Hotel for 3 nights. Santa Monica is absolutely beautiful. The weather was warm so we could go to the beach or go shopping. You couldnt ask for a better location, directly across the road from Santa Monica Pier.The hotel itself is ok. Nothing flash, but then again you are not paying the horrendous prices of some of the other nearby hotels.The room was pretty basic but it did the job. Air conditioner worked. We had a crib bought to the room which my daughter wouldnt sleep in, so instead she slept between my husband and myself. The staff are friendly and they were pretty accommodating letting us heat up my daughters food in the microwave(althouh we stopped once we saw the filthy state of the microwave.)It looked like nobody had ever cleaned it. We always went out for breakfast because the first day we went to the lobby and saw the knives were dirty and there were dead bugs all around the breakfast area which nobody bothered to clean. Other than this it was a pleasant stay. But be warned, on a weekend it gets noisy. We had a courtyard room and could hear all the party animals collecting their car, followed by the dumpster being emptied at 6am
reviews.title: Great Location, and ok hotel

reviews.text: First thing, I visited Manhattan beach, Las Vegas in the same days and payed much more less for the Hotels. 179 US$ for night. I arrived at 1.30 pm and the room was not ready yet, two workers people were in the room and they were not the housekeeping; the reply to my complaint was that the checkin timing was up to 2.00 pm. I tried to connect the internet connection in the room, no good result , it was not working; then I tried to connect in the hall wireless system, no way to get an internet connection, even if I asked the receptionist. He knew that it was not working but no notice has been given. The drink dispenser in the third floor is not working with the credit cards. Once again no sign or warning or notice was available locally or throught the reception. The internet station in the hall, working with credit cards, was not working at all. No guest pen or pencil were available in the room. But the last and not least was the ATM cash dispenser : I put my cash card (that worked fine even in Kazakhistan) in the machine and after completing the procedure , an error was written on the screen suggesting to contact the technician. I went to the receptionist and she told me " Yes I know it's not working, but you can try another place"; again no warning for the out of order. THe afternoon, after I left the hotel my bank debited me the amount that I was supposed to withdraw!!! I wrote an email to the "[--] but no answer so far (of course I have a bank statement as evedence). I'm already back in Europe now. I traveled a lot, including China and less civilized areas, but never I saw a "hotel" like that for that price!! Bad service, never saw a breakfast like that!!! Bad trembling and scratched tables, with mexicans workers resting next to you on the table, talking about their own business; 5 cents muffins with paper dishes, everything really really poor!!!
reviews.title: Never go there !

reviews.text: I will never suggest such hotel to my friends and I'm wondering if I will rely again on the Best Western company.
reviews.title: The staff was very helpful and friendly

reviews.text: We asked to change rooms and were accommodated the next morning. I left my cell phone charger after checkout and returned the next day and it was at the front desk waiting for me.
reviews.title: Not a bad hotel
